recipes.name: Palak Paneer
instructions: Blanch the spinach leaves in boiling water for a minute, then drain and puree them.
Heat ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds.
Once the cumin seeds crackle, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the masala.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add spinach puree and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add cubed paneer and mix gently.
Pour in the heavy cream and simmer for a minute.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

recipes.name: Chole Bhature
instructions: For Chole:
Pressure cook soaked chickpeas until tender.
Heat ghee or oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
Once the cumin seeds crackle, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add tomato puree, chole masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Cook the masala until the oil separates from it.
Add cooked chickpeas and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
For Bhature:
In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, semolina, plain yogurt, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Knead the mixture into a soft dough, adding water if needed.
Cover the dough and let it rest for 2 hours.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll each ball into a circular shape.
Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the rolled dough until golden brown and puffed.
Serve hot Bhature with Chole.

recipes.name: Vegetable Biryani
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans, etc.)
A few strands of saffron soaked in milk
Whole spices (cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, cloves, bay leaves)
Chopped cilantro and mint leaves for garnish
instructions: Wash basmati rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
Heat ghee or oil in a large pot and add whole spices.
Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, biryani masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add mixed vegetables and cook for a few minutes.
Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pot. Mix gently.
Add yogurt and saffron-soaked milk. Mix well.
Add enough water to cook the rice (usually double the quantity of rice).
Cover the pot and cook on low heat until the rice is fully cooked and fluffy.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and mint leaves.
Serve hot with raita or yogurt.

recipes.name: Aloo Gobi
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
Once the cumin seeds crackle, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cauliflower florets and cubed potatoes. Mix gently to coat them with the masala.
Cover the pan and cook on low heat until the vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with chopped cilantro.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

recipes.name: Paneer Tikka
instructions: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt.
Add paneer cubes, bell pepper cubes, and onion cubes to the marinade. Mix gently to coat them well.
Cover the bowl and let the paneer and vegetables marinate for 30 minutes.
Preheat the grill or oven to medium-high heat.
Thread the marinated paneer, bell pepper, and onion onto skewers.
Brush the skewers with oil.
Grill the paneer tikka skewers for 10-15 minutes, turning them occasionally, until the paneer is slightly charred and the vegetables are cooked.
Remove from the grill or oven and serve hot.

recipes.name: Caprese Salad
instructions: Arrange tomato slices and mozzarella slices on a platter.
Tuck basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Mushroom Risotto
instructions: In a saucepan, heat vegetable broth and keep it warm.
In a separate large saucepan, heat olive oil and butter over medium heat.
Add onions and garlic, and sauté until onions are translucent.
Add mushrooms and cook until they release their moisture.
Add Arborio rice and stir to coat with the oil and butter.
If using, pour in the white wine and cook until it is absorbed.
Begin adding the warm vegetable broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring constantly and allowing the liquid to be absorbed before adding more.
Continue adding broth and stirring until the rice is creamy and al dente, about 20-25 minutes.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve hot.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Chili
ingredients: 1 can (15 ounces) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (15 ounces) black beans, drained and rinsed
Optional toppings: shredded cheese, chopped cilantro, sour cream
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onions, garlic, bell pepper, and zucchini. Sauté until vegetables are tender.
Add kidney beans, black beans, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, chili powder, cumin, and paprika.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Bring the chili to a simmer and let it cook for 20-30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
Serve hot with optional toppings like shredded cheese, chopped cilantro, and sour cream.

recipes.name: Vegetable Lasagna
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as spinach, zucchini, and bell peppers), chopped
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sauté for a minute.
Add mixed vegetables and cook until they are tender.
Season with dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
In a baking dish, spread a thin layer of marinara sauce.
Place three lasagna noodles on top of the sauce.
Spread ricotta cheese over the noodles, followed by the cooked vegetables.
Sprinkle mozzarella and Parmesan cheese over the vegetables.
Repeat the layers with the remaining ingredients, finishing with a layer of marinara sauce and cheese on top.
Cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes until the cheese is bubbly and golden.
Let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Falafel
instructions: Drain the soaked chickpeas and pat them dry.
In a food processor, combine chickpeas, parsley, cilantro, onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, baking soda, salt, and pepper.
Pulse the mixture until it forms a coarse paste.
Transfer the mixture to a bowl and refrigerate for 1-2 hours.
Shape the chilled mixture into small patties.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Fry the falafel patties until they are golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Remove from the pan and drain on paper towels.
Serve hot with pita bread and tahini sauce.

recipes.name: Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat the oven to the highest temperature.
Roll out the pizza dough into a round shape.
Place the dough on a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Spread marinara sauce evenly over the dough.
Arrange mozzarella slices on top of the sauce.
Tuck basil leaves between the cheese slices.
Drizzle olive oil over the pizza.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Greek Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, bell pepper, and Kalamata olives.
Toss the ingredients to mix well.
Sprinkle crumbled feta cheese over the salad.
Drizzle olive oil and red wine vinegar over the salad.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with fresh oregano leaves.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Remove the stems from the mushrooms and set them aside.
Arrange the mushroom caps on a baking sheet.
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add spinach leaves and cook until wilted.
Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
Chop the mushroom stems and add them to the skillet.
Add crumbled feta cheese, bread crumbs, grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Mix well.
Spoon the spinach and feta mixture into the mushroom caps, filling them generously.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the filling is golden brown.
Serve hot as an appetizer or side dish.

recipes.name: Vegetable Quiche
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, mushrooms, and spinach), chopped
1 cup shredded cheese (such as cheddar or Swiss)
2 tablespoons chopped fresh herbs (such as parsley or basil)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Line a pie dish with the pie crust and set aside.
In a skillet, sauté chopped vegetables and onion until tender.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, shredded cheese, chopped herbs, salt, and pepper.
Spread the sautéed vegetables and onion evenly in the pie crust.
Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the quiche is set and golden brown on top.
Let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as broccoli, bell peppers, carrots, and snow peas), sliced
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch, water, salt, and pepper to make the sauce.
In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add minced garlic and sliced onion. Stir-fry for a minute until fragrant.
Add mixed vegetables to the wok and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes, or until they are crisp-tender.
Pour the sauce over the vegetables and stir to coat evenly.
Continue cooking for another 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce thickens and coats the vegetables.
Remove from heat and serve hot with steamed rice or noodles.

recipes.name: Cheesy Veggie Quesadilla
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, onions, and zucchini), sliced
1 cup shredded cheese (such as cheddar or Monterey Jack)
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add mixed vegetables and sauté until they are tender-crisp.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Remove the vegetables from the skillet and set them aside.
In the same skillet, place one tortilla.
Sprinkle half of the shredded cheese over the tortilla.
Top with half of the sautéed vegetables, sliced black olives, and chopped cilantro.
Place another tortilla on top and press lightly.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the cheese starts to melt and the bottom tortilla is golden brown.
Flip the quesadilla and cook for another 2-3 minutes on the other side, until the cheese is fully melted and both tortillas are golden brown.
Remove from heat and repeat the process with the remaining tortillas and fillings.
Cut the quesadillas into wedges and serve hot with salsa and sour cream.

recipes.name: Creamy Tomato Basil Soup
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic. Sauté until onions are translucent.
Add diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, vegetable broth, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
Using an immersion blender or regular blender, puree the soup until smooth.
Return the soup to the pot and stir in heavy cream and chopped fresh basil.
Simmer for another 5 minutes, or until the soup is heated through.
Serve hot with crusty bread or grilled cheese sandwiches.

recipes.name: Vegetable Paella
instructions: In a large paella pan or skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic. Sauté until onions are translucent.
Add diced bell pepper and zucchini. Sauté until vegetables are tender.
Stir in diced tomatoes and cook for another minute.
Add Arborio rice, vegetable broth, smoked paprika, saffron threads, salt, and pepper.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low.
Cover the pan and let the paella simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
Stir in frozen peas and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until the peas are heated through.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

recipes.name: Pad Thai
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add diced tofu and cook until it turns golden brown.
Push the tofu to one side of the skillet and add minced garlic to the other side. Sauté until fragrant.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, tamarind paste, brown sugar, lime juice, and red pepper flakes.
Pour the sauce over the tofu and garlic. Stir to coat the tofu evenly.
Add cooked rice noodles to the skillet and toss everything together.
Add chopped peanuts and green onions. Stir-fry for another minute.
Remove from heat and garnish with bean sprouts and lime wedges.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Vegetable Biryani
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans, etc.)
A few strands of saffron soaked in milk
Whole spices (cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, cloves, bay leaves)
Chopped cilantro and mint leaves for garnish
instructions: Wash basmati rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
Heat ghee or oil in a large pot and add whole spices.
Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, biryani masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add mixed vegetables and cook for a few minutes.
Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pot. Mix gently.
Add yogurt and saffron-soaked milk. Mix well.
Add enough water to cook the rice (usually double the quantity of rice).
Cover the pot and cook on low heat until the rice is fully cooked and fluffy.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and mint leaves.
Serve hot with raita or yogurt.

recipes.name: Miso Soup
ingredients: 1 sheet nori (seaweed), torn into small pieces
instructions: In a pot, bring vegetable broth to a simmer over medium heat.
In a small bowl, dissolve miso paste in a few tablespoons of hot broth.
Add the miso mixture to the pot and stir well.
Add diced tofu, sliced green onions, sliced mushrooms, and torn nori to the pot.
Simmer for 5-10 minutes, or until the tofu is heated through and the flavors meld together.
Taste and adjust the seasoning with soy sauce and sesame oil, if desired.
Remove from heat and serve hot.

recipes.name: Vegetable Spring Rolls
ingredients: 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
instructions: In a bowl, mix shredded cabbage, shredded carrots, bean sprouts, sliced bell peppers, and chopped green onions.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and cornstarch-water mixture.
Heat oil in a pan or wok over medium heat.
Add the vegetable mixture to the pan and stir-fry for a few minutes until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Pour the sauce over the vegetables and stir to coat evenly.
Remove from heat and let the filling cool.
Place a spring roll wrapper on a clean surface.
Spoon about 2 tablespoons of the vegetable filling onto the wrapper.
Fold the sides of the wrapper over the filling and roll tightly.
Dab the edges of the wrapper with water to seal the spring roll.
Repeat the process with the remaining wrappers and filling.
Heat oil in a deep pan or fryer to 350°F (175°C).
Fry the spring rolls in batches until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove from the oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve hot with dipping sauce of your choice.

recipes.name: Tofu Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 block of tofu, drained and cubed
2 cups mixed vegetables (such as broccoli, bell peppers, and carrots), sliced
1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add cubed tofu to the skilletand stir-fry until it turns golden brown on all sides.
Add sliced vegetables to the skillet and stir-fry until they are tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and cornstarch-water mixture.
Pour the sauce over the tofu and vegetables. Stir to coat everything evenly.
Continue cooking for a few minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the tofu and vegetables.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Remove from heat and serve hot with steamed rice or noodles.

recipes.name: Kimchi Fried Rice
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add diced tofu to the skillet and stir-fry until it turns golden brown.
Add chopped kimchi and sliced green onions to the skillet. Stir-fry for a few minutes until the kimchi is heated through.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, sesame oil, gochujang, and sugar.
Add cooked rice to the skillet and stir to break up any clumps.
Pour the sauce over the rice and kimchi mixture. Stir-fry for a few more minutes until everything is well combined.
Remove from heat and garnish with a fried egg and toasted sesame seeds, if desired.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Vegetable Curry
instructions: In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic. Sauté until onions are translucent.
Add diced bell pepper, carrots, zucchini, cauliflower florets, and green peas to the pot.
Cook for a few minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender.
Add diced tomatoes, coconut milk, curry powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Stir everything together and bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are cooked and the flavors meld together.
Taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Vegetable Tempura
ingredients: Assorted vegetables (such as sweet potatoes, zucchini, mushrooms, and bell peppers), sliced
Dipping sauce (such as soy sauce or tempura sauce)
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together all-purpose flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and salt.
Add ice-cold water to the flour mixture and whisk until smooth.
Heat oil in a deep pan or fryer to 350°F (175°C).
Dip sliced vegetables into the batter, coating them evenly.
Carefully place the battered vegetables in the hot oil and fry until they turn golden brown and crispy.
Remove from the oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve hot with dipping sauce of your choice.

recipes.name: Thai Red Curry
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, bamboo shoots, and baby corn)
instructions: In a large skillet or wok, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add red curry paste to the skillet and sauté for a minute until fragrant.
Add coconut milk to the skillet and stir to combine with the curry paste.
Add mixed vegetables and diced tofu to the skillet. Stir-fry for a few minutes until the vegetables are tender.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, brown sugar, lime juice, and salt.
Pour the sauce over the vegetables and tofu. Stir to coat everything evenly.
Simmer the curry for 5-10 minutes, or until the flavors meld together.
Remove from heat and stir in fresh basil leaves.
Serve hot with cooked rice.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Sushi Rolls
ingredients: Assorted vegetables (such as cucumber, avocado, carrot, and bell pepper), thinly sliced
Wasabi and pickled ginger for serving (optional)
instructions: Cook sushi rice according to package instructions, then let it cool to room temperature.
Place a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat or a clean surface.
Spread a thin layer of sushi rice over the nori, leaving a small border at the top.
Arrange thinly sliced vegetables in a row across the rice.
Using the sushi mat, tightly roll the nori and rice around the vegetables.
Repeat the process with the remaining nori sheets and ingredients.
Using a sharp knife,slice each sushi roll into bite-sized pieces.
Serve the vegetarian sushi rolls with soy sauce for dipping.
You can also serve with wasabi and pickled ginger, if desired.

recipes.name: Vegetable Pho
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (such as bok choy, bean sprouts, and mushrooms)
Fresh cilantro and sliced green onions for garnish
instructions: In a large pot, bring vegetable broth to a simmer over medium heat.
Cook rice noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a separate pan, heat a small amount of oil and sauté minced garlic until fragrant.
Add mixed vegetables and sliced tofu to the pan. Stir-fry until the vegetables are tender.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, hoisin sauce, lime juice, and sriracha, if using.
Pour the sauce into the pot of simmering broth and stir well.
Add cooked rice noodles and stir to combine.
Divide the pho into bowls and garnish with fresh cilantro and sliced green onions.
Serve hot with lime wedges on the side.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Bibimbap
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (such as spinach, carrots, bean sprouts, and mushrooms)
instructions: In a bowl, mix diced tofu with soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add the marinated tofu to the pan and cook until it turns golden brown on all sides.
Remove the tofu from the pan and set it aside.
In the same pan, sauté mixed vegetables until they are tender.
In a bowl, combine cooked rice with gochujang and sesame oil. Mix well.
Divide the rice among serving bowls.
Arrange sautéed vegetables and tofu on top of the rice.
Garnish with a fried egg and toasted sesame seeds, if desired.
Serve hot and mix everything together before eating.

recipes.name: Vegetable Dim Sum
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (such as cabbage, carrots, and mushrooms), finely chopped
Soy sauce or dipping sauce for serving
instructions: In a bowl, mix chopped vegetables, crumbled tofu, soy sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch, minced ginger, minced garlic, and chopped green onions.
Place a dumpling wrapper on a clean surface and spoon about 1 tablespoon of the vegetable mixture onto the center of the wrapper.
Dip your finger in water and wet the edges of the wrapper.
Fold the wrapper in half and press the edges to seal. You can also fold the edges decoratively.
Repeat the process with the remaining dumpling wrappers and filling.
Prepare a steamer and brush the steaming tray with oil to prevent sticking.
Arrange the dumplings on the steaming tray, leaving some space between them.
Steam the dumplings for 12-15 minutes, or until the wrappers are translucent and the filling is cooked.
Remove from the steamer and serve hot with soy sauce or dipping sauce of your choice.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Phad Thai
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add diced tofu and cook until it turns golden brown.
Push the tofu to one side of the skillet and add minced garlic to the other side. Sauté until fragrant.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, tamarind paste, brown sugar, lime juice, and red pepper flakes.
Pour the sauce over the tofu and garlic. Stir to coat the tofu evenly.
Add cooked rice noodles to the skillet and toss everything together.
Add chopped peanuts and green onions. Stir-fry for another minute.
Remove from heat and garnish with bean sprouts and lime wedges.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Laksa
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (such as tofu, bean sprouts, and sliced mushrooms)
Fresh cilantro and sliced red chili for garnish
instructions: In a pot, combine coconut milk, vegetable broth, and laksa paste. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Add mixed vegetables to the pot and simmer until they are tender.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, and salt.
Add the soy sauce mixture to the pot and stir to combine.
Divide the cooked rice noodles among serving bowls.
Pour the laksa soup over the noodles and top with fresh cilantro and sliced red chili.
Serve hot.
